<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 326, 294]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 155, 314]]<|/det|>
Paper 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 278, 905, 294]]<|/det|>
0606/23  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 905, 315]]<|/det|>

2 hours

Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 435, 375]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Electronic calculator  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 715, 432]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 325, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 461, 504, 476]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 282, 516]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 516, 828, 546]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 545, 593, 560]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 603, 574]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 585, 606, 600]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 600, 759, 615]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 615, 437, 630]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 73, 594, 89]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 165, 559, 182]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 195, 233, 212]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 225, 371, 243]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(a x^{2} + b x + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 243, 583, 279]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}.\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 300, 222, 317]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[253, 322, 745, 361]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 368, 490, 406]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 470, 591, 488]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 502, 153, 519]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 530, 580, 600]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 628, 235, 645]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[410, 653, 590, 685]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 705, 590, 725]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 732, 556, 761]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The first four terms in the expansion of \(\left(1 + a x\right)^{5}\left(2 + b x\right)\) are \(2 + 32x + 210x^{2} + cx^{3}\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers. Show that \(3a^{2} - 16a + 21 = 0\) and hence find the values of \(a, b\) and \(c\). [8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 143, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 74, 870, 94]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y = 2x^{2} - 4x - 7\), write \(y\) in the form \(a(x - b)^{2} + c\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 293, 141, 312]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 292, 756, 312]]<|/det|>
Hence write down the minimum value of \(y\) and the value of \(x\) at which it occurs.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 293, 920, 312]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[106, 415, 141, 434]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 415, 920, 451]]<|/det|>
Using your answer to **part (i)**, solve the equation \(2p - 4\sqrt{p} - 7 = 0\), giving your answer correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 433, 920, 452]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 99, 98]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 77, 532, 101]]<|/det|>
Solve \(3\cot^{2}\Bigl (y - \frac{\pi}{4}\Bigr) = 1\) for \(0< y< \pi\) radians.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 79, 920, 98]]<|/det|>

<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 273, 920, 310]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows points \(O, A, B, C, D\) and \(X\). The position vectors of \(A, B,\) and \(C\) relative to \(O\) are \(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a},\) \(\overrightarrow{OB} = 2\mathbf{b}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OC} = 3\mathbf{a}\). The vector \(\overrightarrow{CD} = \mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 322, 144, 341]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 320, 576, 343]]<|/det|>
